Muslim_history.description: This subcategory includes the history of Muslims and Islamic civilization, from the life of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to the present day.

Muslim_demographics.description: This subcategory includes information on the global distribution of Muslims, as well as data on their age, gender, education, and socioeconomic status.
topics: Age, gender, education, and socioeconomic status of Muslims

Muslim_culture_and_traditions.description: This subcategory includes the various customs, traditions, and practices of Muslim communities around the world, such as dress, food, music, and holidays.

Muslim_organizations_and_institutions.description: This subcategory includes the various organizations and institutions that serve Muslim communities, such as mosques, charities, advocacy groups, and educational institutions.
topics: Advocacy groups and human rights organizations

Muslim-majority_countries.description: This subcategory includes information on the countries with the largest Muslim populations, their histories, cultures, politics, and economies.
topics: Islamic history and culture of different regions

Muslim_contributions_to_society.description: This subcategory includes the various contributions that Muslims have made to fields such as science, art, literature, and philosophy, as well as their impact on global civilization. Muslims have a rich and diverse cultural heritage, and have made significant contributions to human knowledge and progress throughout history. Some examples of Muslim contributions to society include the development of algebra and other mathematical concepts, the preservation and translation of classical Greek and Roman texts, the production of intricate Islamic art and architecture, and the cultivation of diverse philosophical and spiritual traditions.

Muslim_religious_practices.description: This subcategory includes the various religious practices that Muslims engage in, such as daily prayers, fasting, giving charity, and performing pilgrimage to Mecca. These practices are considered essential to the Muslim faith, and help to cultivate a strong connection between the individual and their Creator, as well as with other members of the community. Muslims are expected to pray five times a day, fast during the month of Ramadan, give to charity, and perform Hajj (pilgrimage) to Mecca if they are physically and financially able to do so.

Muslim_ethics_and_values.description: This subcategory includes the ethical and moral values that are central to Islam, such as honesty, generosity, compassion, and justice, and how these values are expressed in daily life. Muslims are expected to adhere to a high standard of ethical behavior, and to strive to cultivate these virtues in all areas of their lives. These values are also reflected in the various social, economic, and political institutions that Muslim communities have developed throughout history, such as zakat (charity), waqf (endowment), and shura (consultation).
